commit_message:
Remove six usage

This repo does not support Python 2 anymore, so we don't need
six for compatibility between Python2 and 3, convert six usage to Python
3 code.

Change-Id: I24d1d8fa8569628edd17f02c5d4d317b0b440a52

commit_message:
Remove six usage

This repo does not support Python 2 anymore, so we don't need
six for compatibility between Python2 and 3, convert six usage to Python
3 code.

Change-Id: Id84564d8350fb793a2511abae218db17ea122873
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/701743

(1 comment)

I think this looks like a pretty good start. I think we need to try and take into account the following different user types.

- Mistral Administrators (install/configure/upgrade/maintain)
- Mistral Users (Workflow authors)
- Mistral Developers (Action writers, plugin writers etc. - possibly just an advanced user?)
- Mistral Contributors (Developers of Mistral itself)

I would suggest that we roughly order the documentation like this too. As I think it is in order of complexity (except for administrators, but you gotta be installed before you can use it!).'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-06-05 05:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
New more user friendly documentation for Mistral

Mistral documentation should be renewed. The idea
of the proposal is to discuss and create new skeleton for Mistral docs, then
fill the documentation with as much information as we can.

Change-Id: I6fcb00ab5c3b8db5c87b36d3678208e7ccc843f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-10 12:16:12.000000000', 'message': "Make gem install options explicit

The default behavior of `gem install` with regard to the location of the
installed gems and binaries is different in CentOS7, CentOS8 and Ubuntu
so let's make options explicit to get the desired behavior in all cases
and configurations, what means getting gems installed under GEM_HOME to
avoid depending on system wise PATH declarations and installed gems.

Change-Id: I992a930491f65ba9871c3f94806afce54bef9c7b
(cherry picked from commit cf77be5c48db38a35db589357a6243f5b028b33b)
"}]
commit_message:
Make gem install options explicit

The default behavior of `gem install` with regard to the location of the
installed gems and binaries is different in CentOS7, CentOS8 and Ubuntu
so let's make options explicit to get the desired behavior in all cases
and configurations, what means getting gems installed under GEM_HOME to
avoid depending on system wise PATH declarations and installed gems.

Change-Id: I992a930491f65ba9871c3f94806afce54bef9c7b
(cherry picked from commit cf77be5c48db38a35db589357a6243f5b028b33b)

commit_message:
Pin gettext < 3.3.0

We need this here since r10k is the ultimate cause
of the issue.

Dependency chain is:
r10k -> puppet_forge -> gettext-setup -> locale -> gettext

Change-Id: If625beff7cbcc2d7261e881e43dcd43b6e4d9cba
(cherry picked from commit 57785448ce4e0d2ffece98022c268c9e773d3912)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-19 14:39:20.000000000', 'message': "Remove the tripleo.ansible action

This action has never been used in TripleO and was only included for
historical reasons. Originally the Ansible actions were intended to be
moved to the Mistral project and were generic. However, that work has
stalled and over time the Ansible actions in TripleO have become more
TripleO specific. We have been dilligently updating both actions, while
only using one. Removing the one we don't use will make things a little
simpler for everyone.

Change-Id: I1a008aa88cea4366203c102443552bc07644d54d
"}, {'created': '2019-12-19 14:46:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove the tripleo.ansible action

stalled and over time the Ansible actions in TripleO have become more

only using one. Removing the one we don't use will make things a little
simpler for everyone.

Change-Id: I1a008aa88cea4366203c102443552bc07644d54d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the tripleo.ansible action

This action has never been used in TripleO and was only included for
historical reasons. Originally the Ansible actions were intended to be
moved to the Mistral project and were generic. However, that work has
stalled and over time the Ansible actions in TripleO have become more
TripleO specific. We have been diligently updating both actions, while
only using one. Removing the one we don't use will make things a little
simpler for everyone.

Change-Id: I1a008aa88cea4366203c102443552bc07644d54d

commit_message:
Improve output of vxlan networking tasks

Prints errors on console when tasks fail, keeping them silent
when succesfull.

Partial-Bug: #1787912

Remove six usage

This repo does not support Python 2 anymore, so we don't need
six for compatibility between Python2 and 3, convert six usage to Python
3 code.

commit_message:
Fix multi-listener LB with missing certificate

This patch allows listeners on a load balancer to continue to
operate should one listener fail to access secret content in
barbican. Previously if one listener failed to access barbican
content, all of the listeners would be impacted.
This patch also cleans up some unused code and unnecessary comments.

Change-Id: I300839fe7cf88763e1e0b8c484029662beb64f0a
Story: 2006676
Task: 36951

- version

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

[{'created': '2019-12-13 14:33:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix list zones updated at same time

In case multiple zones have the same update timestamp (updated_at) the
UI did not show any zone and a JS console listed an error
"Error: [ngRepeat:dupes] Duplicates in a repeater are not allowed."
To fix it addTimestampIds needs to get the correct parameter order,
i.e. pass the name of the ID column before the timestamp column name.

Closes-Bug: 1734601

Change-Id: Ib91f873e8f21b71a71b1684317db276b72ae8014
(cherry picked from commit c6d53e4f8a36046c55e08272bf3859d5cb4c7c44)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix list zones updated at same time

In case multiple zones have the same update timestamp (updated_at) the
UI did not show any zone and a JS console listed an error
"Error: [ngRepeat:dupes] Duplicates in a repeater are not allowed."
To fix it addTimestampIds needs to get the correct parameter order,
i.e. pass the name of the ID column before the timestamp column name.

Closes-Bug: 1734601

Change-Id: Ib91f873e8f21b71a71b1684317db276b72ae8014
(cherry picked from commit c6d53e4f8a36046c55e08272bf3859d5cb4c7c44)

commit_message:
don't clear skb mark when ovs is hw-offload enabled

skb mark is not supported when using ovs hw-offload and using it
breaks the vxlan offload.

This patch clear skb mark only if ovs hw-offload is disabled.
This should be fine as ovs with hw-offload runs on the
compute node (DVR is not supported), so clear the skb mark for
the qrouter is not needed.

Closes-Bug: #1855888

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I71f45fcd9b7e7bdacaafc7fa96c775e88333ab48
(cherry picked from commit a75ec08ddb6a672ba685a11ba3f7df1569497723)
(cherry picked from commit bee5059ccb35e23d3c84ae8f959fa695f8cae931)
(cherry picked from commit 169b4baa6f9a43ab3996f27051c0ae01ee854193)

commit_message:
Disable journald-remote playbook

The journald-remote playbook is disabled by default until
https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/2376 has been
incorporated in current systemd packages.

Change-Id: Ie70729eaad095b52813610b94c6618c84b05c148
Closes-Bug: #1853198
(cherry picked from commit 1bd21d80e47a66be145911d6be80992dbe0cc7c2)

    from http import client as http_client

The http lib was renamed in py3, and python-ironicclient removed the six translation via [2].

So the problem here is that the job is running under py2. IMO we should fix that (in a separate patch would be fine) before we land this.

commit_message:
Constrain openstackclient-check-plugins run on master

This job is currently running on stable branches, but that is now
resulting in the master version of openstackclient being pulled into the
job. That then will install the latest versions of things, and ends up
failing due to newer libraries being installed than what is in the
stable branch's upper-constraints.

Change-Id: Iedb94a84d2f09c05cc575a955b508e0fd6ca0a64
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: Ieebda9acba54174fbc3f6312897a4260a0a775ef

commit_message:
Use mock instead of mox in unit tests

As a part of global effort remove mox usage in heat-dashboard
and replace it with mock.

Change-Id: Idac0930651961703f49f36fac94139b46db104c3
Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Opasiak <k.opasiak@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Start README.rst with a better title

Now that we are using gitea the contents of our README.rst are
more prominently displayed. Starting it with a "Team and repository
tags" title is a bit confusing. This change makes it start with the
name of the project instead.

Change-Id: Ic089a67236921adb62f3e3719d8bb9163c17ebda

commit_message:
tripleo-container-manage: show podman commands that are executed

This patch will display the podman commands that are executed for debug
purpose, when check is enabled.
For each container, it'll show the command and also at the very end of
the playbook run, we display ALL commands that were run.

It's replacing the "paunch debug print-cmd" feature that we had with
paunch.

Note: it's disabling async on podman_container module because async +
check don't work together.

story: 2006732
task: 37310

Change-Id: Ic615dd45d8feec3806d5012685e4860d2361b95d

commit_message:
lint: bump flake8

- Use recommended flake8 setup in pre-commit
- Removes use of hacking as pre-commit provides the lock-in
- Bumps flake8 to latest stable
- Resolves two ignored rules

Change-Id: I98f382cd2b72345748e40106624c73039e0f0f2c

commit_message:
zun: bump docker_remote_api_version to 1.26

In before, we set docker_remote_api_version to 1.24 to match
the docker version used by kolla at that time.
This commit remove this setting, which effectively bump to
version to 1.26 (default in zun).

Related-Bug: #1859176

We introduce a new tripleo::haproxy parameter called mysql_custom_listen_options

parameter_defaults:

commit_message:
Allow mysql haproxy stanza do be customized

We introduce a new tripleo::haproxy parameter called mysql_custom_listen_options
which can be used to customize mysql listen options in haproxy's config.

Tested as follows:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_default_timeout:
      - 'http-request 10s'
      - 'queue 2m'
      - 'connect 10s'
      - 'client 5m'
      - 'server 5m'
      - 'check 10s'
    tripleo::haproxy::cinder::options:
      bind-process: 2
    tripleo::haproxy::glance_api::options:
      bind-process: 2
    tripleo::haproxy::mysql_custom_listen_options:
      bind-process: 2

Observed that haproxy's mysql stanza had:
listen mysql
  bind 172.17.1.91:3306 transparent
  bind-process 2
  option tcpka
  option httpchk

Before this patch this was not the case and the tripleo::haproxy::<mysql>::options just got ignored.

Closes-Bug: #1858775

Change-Id: Ia0ecca5b54c1ca51898035e641665150dbdac9f7
(cherry picked from commit c42c5aa67828c8277d676e609bc828eb1dd1ba37)
(cherry picked from commit 64951b5c124b90e97404a7ad5c1439a768afbb2a)

commit_message:
Allow mysql haproxy stanza do be customized

We introduce a new tripleo::haproxy parameter called mysql_custom_listen_options
which can be used to customize mysql listen options in haproxy's config.

Tested as follows:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_default_timeout:
      - 'http-request 10s'
      - 'queue 2m'
      - 'connect 10s'
      - 'client 5m'
      - 'server 5m'
      - 'check 10s'
    tripleo::haproxy::cinder::options:
      bind-process: 2
    tripleo::haproxy::glance_api::options:
      bind-process: 2
    tripleo::haproxy::mysql_custom_listen_options:
      bind-process: 2

Observed that haproxy's mysql stanza had:
listen mysql
  bind 172.17.1.91:3306 transparent
  bind-process 2
  option tcpka
  option httpchk

Before this patch this was not the case and the tripleo::haproxy::<mysql>::options just got ignored.

Closes-Bug: #1858775

Change-Id: Ia0ecca5b54c1ca51898035e641665150dbdac9f7
(cherry picked from commit c42c5aa67828c8277d676e609bc828eb1dd1ba37)
(cherry picked from commit 64951b5c124b90e97404a7ad5c1439a768afbb2a)

commit_message:
nova-compute: add tripleo-container-shutdown service dep

Like we did for paunch-container-shutdown.service, we need to have the
dependency on the new service tripleo-container-shutdown.service managed
by TripleO Ansible which will replace Paunch by default soon.

Change-Id: Idd005b3b8a4fc2a8438798a5c376f6d9dd64ce5f

commit_message:
Add new validation_json callback

This callback converts all events into a JSON output file and push it in
/var/log/validations.

Change-Id: Ibc7689c61062e6154bae67a301090a8392c08c9c
Depends-On: I502c38d3f27db3c6f62a47190136dd03627956bc
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c9c1a541e589a3c7300c2a327e0eb6c567d2b783)

to 1.4

subject: Support datastore namespace for MySQL
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-08 10:07:15.000000000', 'message': "Support datastore namespace for MySQL

With the current implementation of Trove, it's impossible for the user
to use network with subnet conflict with the Trove management network.

This patch introduces the following changes:

- Create 'datastore' network namespace in the MySQL guest instance and
  move the last nic(the user network device) to that namespace. So that
  the trove-guestagent communicates with the control plane via the
  management network, the MySQL service is running in 'datastore'
  namespace.
- Re-order the test cases for CI job trove-functional-mysql
- Move unmaintained datastore diskimage elements into a separate folder

Change-Id: I2fb1d11234c15da3297a4d792a64794691195e09
"}]
commit_message:
Support datastore namespace for MySQL

With the current implementation of Trove, it's impossible for the user
to use network with subnet conflict with the Trove management network.

This patch introduces the following changes:

- Create 'datastore' network namespace in the MySQL guest instance and
  move the last nic(the user network device) to that namespace. So that
  the trove-guestagent communicates with the control plane via the
  management network, the MySQL service is running in 'datastore'
  namespace.
- Re-order the test cases for CI job trove-functional-mysql
- Move unmaintained datastore diskimage elements into a separate folder

Change-Id: I2fb1d11234c15da3297a4d792a64794691195e09

commit_message:
DNM: Test global tempest changes for bug 1844568

For all compute tests in tempest, always create a network and
a subnet (big-hammer approach).

The other approach:
- tempest: https://review.opendev.org/701792
- nova: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701794

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701797
Change-Id: I33a1999477175e402107b458d74fd37af2baaa37
Related-Bug: #1844568

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 16688, 'name': 'Rodolfo Alonso', 'email': 'ralonsoh@redhat.com', 'username': 'rodolfo-alonso-hernandez'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-01-09 18:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-01-09 18:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-09 18:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just a note, if this does work, we can remove the overrides in some of the subclasses.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-09 22:26:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Whoah, https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701799/ worked.

Does that mean we can move forward with this, or is there some reason not to use the big-hammer approach?'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-01-10 00:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IMO, making the network explicit in the server creation is not a limitation but something mandatory. This patch approach is valid'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-01-10 00:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-10 04:58:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Then let's do it!"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-01-10 09:42:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I'm OK with this approach. Thanks Rodolfo!"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-01-10 10:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-01-10 11:29:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Go for it!'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-01-10 14:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-10 14:52:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

recheck

I'll abandon mine.

We can do a followon to remove the redundant overrides from subclasses."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-01-10 19:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Dynamic credential by default create the network for each tenant.
For compute tests we disabled that in base class and assumed each test class creating server successfullyl will request the network resource creation.

I am ok with flipping the behaviour which mean compute base class enable network creation by default and each parent test class explicitly mention not to create the network.

Current change only take care of first part but not second which is explicitly disable network creation from network-not-required-tests. These are below cases:

1. Not all tests derive from BaseV2ComputeTest create server so does not need network like quotas tests. We have to explicitly mention not to create network in each such class by set_network_resources().

2. Few tests like negative test classes create server but does not need network as they are supposed to fail early by nvoa so we have to explicit disable the network creation for those too.

3. This is more cleanup. Any tests creating the network source which now base class will create should be clean up to avoid any furture confusion. Example: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/f5ed8eace70f9d55978a4a2892ec76fae6f498ad/tempest/api/compute/servers/test_virtual_interfaces.py#L38

I am ok to do 3rd things as separate patch but 1st & 2nd should be done with this change.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-10 21:46:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the look gmann.

If we're going to be required to pick and choose which tests have network and which don't, IMO it's better for the default to be off and have tests explicitly needing it turn it on. That's the approach I was working via https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701792/ which I guess I'll restore and continue with now."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-01-11 00:35:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned in favor of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701792/'}]

'}, {'created': '2020-01-10 10:03:06.000000000', 'message': 'Create default network and subnet for all compute tests

In "BaseV2ComputeTest" class create, by default in each test, a
network and a subnet, calling "set_network_resources" with
"network=True" and "subnet=True".

Any child class can define its own default network resources,
overriding the "set_network_resources" method and calling
"set_network_resources" with other parameters.

Change-Id: I13d7833a2be14bf5c29fe888fb838208dfd05589
Partial-Bug: #1844568
'}]
commit_message:
Create default network and subnet for all compute tests

In "BaseV2ComputeTest" class create, by default in each test, a
network and a subnet, calling "set_network_resources" with
"network=True" and "subnet=True".

Any child class can define its own default network resources,
overriding the "set_network_resources" method and calling
"set_network_resources" with other parameters.

Change-Id: I13d7833a2be14bf5c29fe888fb838208dfd05589
Partial-Bug: #1844568

commit_message:
Use py3 for CentOS

Unfortunatelly CentOS 7 do not have libvirt library
for py3, so instead of symlinking them, we have to install devel package
and build inside venv.

Change-Id: I5a2fc38e86debfb9a73394552b79f83e56dd1231

commit_message:
Gate on octavia-v2-dsvm-tls-barbican

At the Shanghai PTG, members of the Barbican and Octavia teams seemed to
agree that job octavia-v2-dsvm-tls-barbican could be made voting in both
projects. The job has proven to be quite stable over time [1].

The patch that make the job voting in Octavia is [2].

[1] http://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=octavia-v2-dsvm-tls-barbican
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697644/

Change-Id: I56dd4b92ccb2545a9b46c743647af11aaa5c94f8

commit_message:
Check "keepalived" is stopped in KeepalivedManagerTestCase

During the test case teardown process, the clean up methods should
check that the "keepalived" process spawned is actually stopped. If
not, the process should be killed (SIGKILL instead of SIGTERM, sent
in "KeepalivedManager.disable()")

TrivalFix

Change-Id: Ifeae4593f56b40de81f234c557349563c1cd6f8c

commit_message:
Fix panels enable/disable for distro install.

Fix problems with distro install method and panel enable task. The
generic task was failling because it did not remove correctly the
panels. This changes use package add and remove in state of only files
remove, which does not work for distro install method.

Change-Id: I736b2f8cc32d17f41ab1ec91cb5e281ffe7a528f

messages: [{'account_id': 31004, 'date': '2020-01-07 10:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-01-07 11:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-01-10 21:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-07 10:50:54.000000000', 'message': 'Updates to Grafana role

The inclusion of the grafana submodule contradicts the deployment
process in the README, where it is explicitly cloned to
/etc/ansible/roles. The empty folder for the submodule takes
higher precendence than explicit clone, meaning that the grafana
role is found, but contains no tasks. The submodule has been
deleted to stop this.

There are also failures when running behind a proxy in the
traefik-common role, These are now avoided by running the role
with deployment_environment_variables set.

Change-Id: Icc34087e17906c763286b98591bade73fa7c022e
'}]
commit_message:
Updates to Grafana role

The inclusion of the grafana submodule contradicts the deployment
process in the README, where it is explicitly cloned to
/etc/ansible/roles. The empty folder for the submodule takes
higher precendence than explicit clone, meaning that the grafana
role is found, but contains no tasks. The submodule has been
deleted to stop this.

There are also failures when running behind a proxy in the
traefik-common role, These are now avoided by running the role
with deployment_environment_variables set.

Change-Id: Icc34087e17906c763286b98591bade73fa7c022e

commit_message:
Cap hacking version to <2

Hacking received a major update to version 2.0.0 that added new checks
that fail on stable branches. Instead of addressing those new check
errors on stable branches, it is better to cap hacking to <2. This way
we'll not see lint errors again should new checks be added in the
future.

Support for hacking 2.0.0 in master branch is being worked in
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/699302/

Since this patch touches requirements file, the requirements-check CI
job also runs and does not find matching gunicorn and sphinx
requirements. This patch fixes that too.

Change-Id: I4706972095d42815a3f3cec0bc5aa82a34922bf3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-10 17:13:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix fast_track + agent_url update fix

In the case of fast_track, we do not power off agents
which allows for operators to perform a rapid transition,
such as those desired when performing a batch installation
of machines.

However, a security fix I1a5e3c2b34d45c06fb74e82d0f30735ce9041914
removed prior traces of an agent_url upon exiting cleaning.

So what was occuring:
- Agent was completing cleaning
- Conductor was removing 'agent_url' from driver internal info
- Agent was heartbeating, but no new agent_url was being recorded
  because how do we know if that is actually the agent.
- Deployment was started.
- Deployment fails upon next heartbeat as there is no 'agent_url'.

This patch places a conditional around the removal of the agent_url
value at the end of cleaning which allows nodes to transition as
through fast track as desired.

Change-Id: I2b5130a0845b327c2244d2d30a19842c46e1eed3
Story: 2007080
Task: 37991
(cherry picked from commit c3955e68a43b513fd367887a30b419bc837b702b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fast_track + agent_url update fix

In the case of fast_track, we do not power off agents
which allows for operators to perform a rapid transition,
such as those desired when performing a batch installation
of machines.

However, a security fix I1a5e3c2b34d45c06fb74e82d0f30735ce9041914
removed prior traces of an agent_url upon exiting cleaning.

So what was occuring:
- Agent was completing cleaning
- Conductor was removing 'agent_url' from driver internal info
- Agent was heartbeating, but no new agent_url was being recorded
  because how do we know if that is actually the agent.
- Deployment was started.
- Deployment fails upon next heartbeat as there is no 'agent_url'.

This patch places a conditional around the removal of the agent_url
value at the end of cleaning which allows nodes to transition as
through fast track as desired.

Change-Id: I2b5130a0845b327c2244d2d30a19842c46e1eed3
Story: 2007080
Task: 37991
(cherry picked from commit c3955e68a43b513fd367887a30b419bc837b702b)

subject: Add missing 'os-infra_hosts' to prod-ceph example
messages:
[{'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2019-01-20 07:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-01-20 09:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Bug 1812540 references the "Pike" release documentation, and I see the os-infra_hosts group referred to elsewhere as 'legacy'. (See https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/blob/master/multi-node-aio/playbooks/osa/openstack_user_config.yml#L236-L238)

This probably means there is a different error with the ceph example.'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2019-01-20 12:07:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

IMHO there are two things:

1. Inconsistent usage of os-infra_hosts

From current openstack-ansible master:

    $ git log -n 1 etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.example
    commit 8d9c0336ecc2b8469c78c7798e5b1871264b8087
    Author: James Denton <james.denton@rackspace.com>
    Date:   Tue Jan 15 12:47:07 2019 +0000

    Make container_interface optional for provider network
    
    As Neutron agents move to bare metal by default, the container_interface
    attribute for a Neutron provider network (e.g. br-vlan, br-vxlan, etc) is
    unnecessary and confusing. This patch aims to change it from a required
    attribute to an optional one.
    
    Change-Id: I52692f5a36e7064c3a6ac6ccafc2420549685a66

    $ grep -A 4 os-infra_hosts etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.example
    # Level: os-infra_hosts (required)
    # List of target hosts on which to deploy the glance API, nova API, heat API,
    # and horizon. Recommend three minimum target hosts for these services.
    # Typically contains the same target hosts as 'shared-infra_hosts' level.
    #

2. (Maybe) deprecated use of 'os-infra_hosts' in openstack-ansible.

This patch is for handling 1. - not 2.

Adding the 'os-infra_hosts' to the config fixed the problem that openstack-ansible stops with an error and it is consistent within openstack-ansible. So IMHO this is a step forward.

Deprecating / removing the 'os-infra_hosts' from openstack-ansible should be handled in a dedicated patch."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-01-03 09:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think that shared-infra_hosts should be used instead of os-infra hosts. According to their env.d files [1] [2] - they are kinda the same. And shared-infra_hosts is already used here and assigned to infrastructure_hosts.


[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/src/branch/master/inventory/env.d/shared-infra.yml
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/src/branch/master/inventory/env.d/os-infra.yml'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2020-01-04 22:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok - when I understand you correctly, instead of os-infra_hosts the var shared-infra_hosts should be used.

The problem is, that this does currently not work in OSA 20.0.0. Re-run this on a complete fresh installation today to check.

When only setting shared-infra_hosts and not os-infra_hosts os-nova stops with:

    TASK [os_nova : Set the delegated task facts] **********************************
    task path: /etc/ansible/roles/os_nova/tasks/nova_db_post_setup.yml:16
    <compute0> Task is delegated to {{ nova_conductor_setup_host }}.
    <compute0> The "physical_host" variable of "compute0" has been found to have a corresponding host entry in inventory.
    <compute0> The "physical_host" variable of "compute0" terminates at "10.0.5.104" using the host variable "ansible_host".
    <compute0> Because this is a task using "delegate_to" pipelining has been disabled. but will be restored upon completion of this task.
    fatal: [compute0]: FAILED! => {"msg": "list object has no element 0"}

The patch is currently based on this experience.  If you think, this is a bug, I'd prefer to report and get this fixed first.  I don't want to introduce a documentation that does not work ;-)'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-01-05 09:30:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yep, I mean, that I never used os-infra_hosts and it's actually not really used in CI as well http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=os-infra_hosts&i=nope&files=&repos=

Can you join our IRC #openstack-ansible at freenode for further conversation?"}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-01-08 12:32:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Yeah, sorry, you was right about os-infra_hosts - it's really required and is different from shared-infra - shared is for memchached, rabbidmq, etc while os-infra is for openstack core set [1].

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=os-infra_containers&i=nope&files=&repos=openstack/openstack-ansible"}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-01-09 10:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>
'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-01-10 21:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

replaced by 701548'}]

commit_message:
Add missing 'os-infra_hosts' to prod-ceph example

The example configuration file for ceph production
is missing the configuration entry for 'os-infra_hosts'
- which is mandatory.

Change-Id: I8d9b7809901e045c3ecd538270833a6e80d1a3a1
Closes-Bug: 1812540
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Barbican is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: I77bf25fedb45433c7dbe655b4fd0c24dcf030549

commit_message:
DNM Enable cinder services explicitly

This updates the job to run devstack in run so we can track down the
problem.

The don't seem to be enabled on stable/pike for us, leading to failure.

Depends-On: I2700154a532f6462a7b420bca507247b770e52b5
Change-Id: I540eb8d9966ca099ba62ffe288169720d5823165

commit_message:
Before writing object data to stdout, re-open it in binary mode

Otherwise, you can hit TypeErrors on Python3.

Change-Id: I9a891508886feddac3982ce593bd95130392e035
Closes-Bug: 1775482
(cherry picked from commit 415b48056d9d021e04ec972029040a89a6b13928)

commit_message:
fix: admin and member gates are broken

The patrole-admin and patrole-member gates are broken because they
are trying to test a policy action ('os_compute_api:os-services') that
was changed in the Ussuri release. This commit adds a new policy feature
flag so that this policy test is backwards compatible.

Change-Id: Ia80279ae8ffcc17f10bed05338c41d0c23eea063

Walk through services' templates role_data to identify
missing hiera interplolation of networks.

Use additionally provided interfaces for validations:
 * search in dicts by keys or values matching some regex,
   entering into lists as an option;
 * safe get values by the discovered paths casted as lists,
   like get_param/get_attr works for heat templates.

Add PyYAML missing to the requirements.txt.

Closes-bug: #1764315

commit_message:
Add validation for hiera interpolation in services

Walk through services' templates role_data to identify
missing hiera interplolation of networks.

Use additionally provided interfaces for validations:
 * search in dicts by keys or values matching some regex,
   entering into lists as an option;
 * safe get values by the discovered paths casted as lists,
   like get_param/get_attr works for heat templates.

Add PyYAML missing to the requirements.txt.

Closes-bug: #1764315

NOTE: Includes https://review.opendev.org/#/c/567125

Change-Id: Idef66ee96cbd67d23760a1cce9537ecc157c3429
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0b44170e73d59959611ad4d7a833101f11d29d4c)

commit_message:
Before writing object data to stdout, re-open it in binary mode

Otherwise, you can hit TypeErrors on Python3.

Change-Id: I9a891508886feddac3982ce593bd95130392e035
Closes-Bug: 1775482

repo_setup role is used to yum repos on host. In order to
install a particular package especially from a particular
repo, the .repo file needs module_hotfixes[1] needs to be
enabled. It is disabled by default.

It is needed for podman third party gating to install package
from different repo.

[1.] https://dnf.readthedocs.io/en/latest/conf_ref.html#repo-options

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Added  module_hotfixes support in repo setup role

repo_setup role is used to yum repos on host. In order to
install a particular package especially from a particular
repo, the .repo file needs module_hotfixes[1] needs to be
enabled. It is disabled by default.

It is needed for podman third party gating to install package
from different repo.

[1.] https://dnf.readthedocs.io/en/latest/conf_ref.html#repo-options
Change-Id: If87a0624bda0fac4f0063814f06c7f31207f390b
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Only set "unknown" in LSP that makes sense

Prior to this patch, the "unknown" address was being set the logical
switch ports solely based on whether the port security was enabled or
disabled. That's not how it's intended to work.

With this patch the "unknown" address is only set to the normal logical
switch ports, those which types are "router", "localnet" or "localport"
won't be affected.

The maintenance task was updated to correct this behavior for existing
ports (the maintenance was suppose to be removed in the T cycle, this
patch bumps it to U cycle instead due to this change).

Closes-Bug: #1838535
Related-Bug: #1815270

Conflicts:
   networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py
   networking_ovn/common/constants.py

Change-Id: I3c01bd7d1685c8a7e13a55e545e98baf19e9a0f9
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6a89dbfe47ae1f384e08fede3bb6afae2ada7b9c)

commit_message:
Add option to build containers from package

This patch adds an option to build containers using
tripleoclient and kolla installed via package not
from source keeping default installation via source.

The initial usage of this feature would be to
build containers from cloudsig RDO repos. The idea
is to use same source(packages) for building containers and
content of containers.

Change-Id: Id7cde12a687a1e2a55717ba6fbc0bb78c80c51f6

commit_message:
Unskip barbican tests so we can run them in scen2

Barbican is configured in scenario02 standalone job and we need to
run it there, if it fails it needs to be added there as a skip list
as master skip list is runned in fs021 where barbican is not
configured.

It includes test_signed_image_upload_boot_failure barbican tests in
skip list and removes rest of the barbican test from there.

Related-Bug: #1820671
Closes-Bug: #1820668

Change-Id: I8b0cd11e5b884bde60f7f87479c2180649f3b95c
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix new parameter added in "qos_port_network_policy" API

The new parameter in "port" API should be "qos_network_policy_id",
not "qos_policy_id", which already exists now.

Change-Id: Ia9bc082b3fae0e3a762ec65a86c8d8c246dcf170
Related-Bug: #1851362

Closes-bug: #1859050

commit_message:
Fix _goal_state_achieved_for_relid() with unsorted lists

Essentially, the functions returning the related units and expected
units (for goal state) might not be sorted, something the author of
the code (me) hadn't taken into account.  This fixes that by comparing
sorted lists.

Change-Id: Id6ca9fc756b0ef18d00863fa4641ab1c244db939
Closes-bug: #1859050

commit_message:
Grafana: Updated the ceph OSD expression

In Ceph Cluster Dashboard the OSDs In, OSDs Out, OSDs Down Panel was
showing wrong values. Updated
the expression from "count" to "sum" to show the correct values.

Change-Id: I1959eeb445bf297c1ec696f3867315f05552b03e

subject: Support listener pooling in keystone listener
messages: [{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-06-12 16:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2019-06-12 16:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28743, 'date': '2019-07-14 11:20:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2019-07-30 21:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2019-10-03 14:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2020-01-10 15:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 16:39:30.000000000', 'message': "Support listener pooling in keystone listener

some oslo.messaging transport backends support listener pooling,
when the listener declares a pool it belongs, and each message of
the topic is delivered once to each pool (plus to 'default' pool for
those that have not declared a pool).
In particular, rabbitmq and kafka support it.
This mechanism should be preferrable over setting a separate topic
for barbican to listen notifications on.

This patch adds a new config option `[keystone_listener]pool_name`
(None by default for backward compatibility) that can be used to set
up barbican-keystone-listener to create a separate pool for its
listeners.

For more details see oslo.messaging docs
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/reference/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: Ie011266f5ebe03bc6053bfe68e2bee27e07ea11c
"}, {'created': '2019-06-12 16:57:30.000000000', 'message': "Support listener pooling in keystone listener

some oslo.messaging transport backends support listener pooling,
when the listener declares a pool it belongs, and each message of
the topic is delivered once to each pool (plus to 'default' pool for
those that have not declared a pool).
In particular, rabbitmq and kafka support it.
This mechanism should be preferrable over setting a separate topic
for barbican to listen notifications on.

This patch adds a new config option `[keystone_notifications]pool_name`
(None by default for backward compatibility) that can be used to set
up barbican-keystone-listener to create a separate pool for its
listeners.

For more details see oslo.messaging docs
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/reference/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: Ie011266f5ebe03bc6053bfe68e2bee27e07ea11c
"}, {'created': '2019-10-03 14:47:00.000000000', 'message': "Support listener pooling in keystone listener

some oslo.messaging transport backends support listener pooling,
when the listener declares a pool it belongs, and each message of
the topic is delivered once to each pool (plus to 'default' pool for
those that have not declared a pool).
In particular, rabbitmq and kafka support it.
This mechanism should be preferrable over setting a separate topic
for barbican to listen notifications on.

This patch adds a new config option `[keystone_notifications]pool_name`
(None by default for backward compatibility) that can be used to set
up barbican-keystone-listener to create a separate pool for its
listeners.

For more details see oslo.messaging docs
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/reference/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: Ie011266f5ebe03bc6053bfe68e2bee27e07ea11c
"}]
commit_message:
Support listener pooling in keystone listener

some oslo.messaging transport backends support listener pooling,
when the listener declares a pool it belongs, and each message of
the topic is delivered once to each pool (plus to 'default' pool for
those that have not declared a pool).
In particular, rabbitmq and kafka support it.
This mechanism should be preferrable over setting a separate topic
for barbican to listen notifications on.

This patch adds a new config option `[keystone_notifications]pool_name`
(None by default for backward compatibility) that can be used to set
up barbican-keystone-listener to create a separate pool for its
listeners.

For more details see oslo.messaging docs
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/reference/notification_listener.html

Change-Id: Ie011266f5ebe03bc6053bfe68e2bee27e07ea11c

[{'created': '2020-01-09 23:10:21.000000000', 'message': 'Change default nic to e1000 for bionic PXE testing

commit_message:
Change default nic to e1000 for bionic PXE testing

Network booting on bionic, by default, doesn't work
with the virtio "firmware" which lacks the PXE stack.

iPXE has traditionally been in the e1000 driver and it
shouldn't be too much overhead for test VMs.

Change-Id: Ic926cd236c2b640414bbd091daccacd213958ae5

commit_message:
baremetal node: 'error' is a failed state

For baremetal.wait_for_provision_state(), if abort_on_failed_state
is True, we need to abort if the node goes into the 'error'
provision state (which happens if a failure occurs while trying
to delete the BM node).

Change-Id: I6f628787dcf458ff9149dbb3502e7beeded70d9e
Story: #2006860
(cherry picked from commit 3c6dae3a657f556adc7e34a22831261e66b1da39)

commit_message:
Simplify octavia post deploy configs

Consolidate post deploy configurations in a single file. Octavia
controller services share many configurations. It is best to consolidate
them in the same configuration file. This fixes problems seen like
amphorae not having the controller_ip_port_list config value set on
failover triggered by the Health Manager service as that config was only
being loaded for the Worker service.

Backport note: this backport also includes https://review.opendev.org/696729/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691925/
Closes-Bug: #1836074

Change-Id: I32524f85ef6a0ca3e87fa9acc8c9e12776225717
(cherry picked from commit c2bb9c0937852d1d5488bc727983fce3435ca898)
(cherry picked from commit 25d8177d143d7933f243543ed12cf4b956167fd1)
(cherry picked from commit 6a45e9b37a9664e753125526211c253dee318368)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-09 10:17:34.000000000', 'message': "Allow mysql haproxy stanza do be customized

We introduce a new tripleo::haproxy parameter called mysql_custom_listen_options
which can be used to customize mysql listen options in haproxy's config.

Tested as follows:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_default_timeout:
      - 'http-request 10s'
      - 'queue 2m'
      - 'connect 10s'
      - 'client 5m'
      - 'server 5m'
      - 'check 10s'
    tripleo::haproxy::cinder::options:
      bind-process: 2
    tripleo::haproxy::glance_api::options:
      bind-process: 2
    tripleo::haproxy::mysql_custom_listen_options:
      bind-process: 2

Observed that haproxy's mysql stanza had:
listen mysql
  bind 172.17.1.91:3306 transparent
  bind-process 2
  option tcpka
  option httpchk

Before this patch this was not the case and the tripleo::haproxy::<mysql>::options just got ignored.

Closes-Bug: #1858775

Change-Id: Ia0ecca5b54c1ca51898035e641665150dbdac9f7
(cherry picked from commit c42c5aa67828c8277d676e609bc828eb1dd1ba37)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow mysql haproxy stanza do be customized

We introduce a new tripleo::haproxy parameter called mysql_custom_listen_options
which can be used to customize mysql listen options in haproxy's config.

Tested as follows:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_default_timeout:
      - 'http-request 10s'
      - 'queue 2m'
      - 'connect 10s'
      - 'client 5m'
      - 'server 5m'
      - 'check 10s'
    tripleo::haproxy::cinder::options:
      bind-process: 2
    tripleo::haproxy::glance_api::options:
      bind-process: 2
    tripleo::haproxy::mysql_custom_listen_options:
      bind-process: 2

Observed that haproxy's mysql stanza had:
listen mysql
  bind 172.17.1.91:3306 transparent
  bind-process 2
  option tcpka
  option httpchk

Before this patch this was not the case and the tripleo::haproxy::<mysql>::options just got ignored.

Closes-Bug: #1858775

Change-Id: Ia0ecca5b54c1ca51898035e641665150dbdac9f7
(cherry picked from commit c42c5aa67828c8277d676e609bc828eb1dd1ba37)

commit_message:
Remove extra backslash in awk for tripleo-ceph-uuid role

This backslash caused bug 1854209. Whitespace in the
multi embedded in YAML is complicated. Seems safer to
just remove it in this case.

Change-Id: I8414a776360700b05fb18d73862797b13a58f32d
Closes-Bug: #1854209

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: I91d9104335ca7d432966b5c19f27dead6f8f57f1

[{'created': '2020-01-09 16:24:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix fast_track + agent_url update fix

In the case of fast_track, we do not power off agents
which allows for operators to perform a rapid transition,
such as those desired when performing a batch installation
of machines.

However, a security fix I1a5e3c2b34d45c06fb74e82d0f30735ce9041914
removed prior traces of an agent_url upon exiting cleaning.

So what was occuring:
- Agent was completing cleaning
- Conductor was removing 'agent_url' from driver internal info
- Agent was heartbeating, but no new agent_url was being recorded
  because how do we know if that is actually the agent.
- Deployment was started.
- Deployment fails upon next heartbeat as there is no 'agent_url'.

This patch places a conditional around the removal of the agent_url
value at the end of cleaning which allows nodes to transition as
through fast track as desired.

Change-Id: I2b5130a0845b327c2244d2d30a19842c46e1eed3
Story: 2007080
Task: 37991
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fast_track + agent_url update fix

In the case of fast_track, we do not power off agents
which allows for operators to perform a rapid transition,
such as those desired when performing a batch installation
of machines.

However, a security fix I1a5e3c2b34d45c06fb74e82d0f30735ce9041914
removed prior traces of an agent_url upon exiting cleaning.

So what was occuring:
- Agent was completing cleaning
- Conductor was removing 'agent_url' from driver internal info
- Agent was heartbeating, but no new agent_url was being recorded
  because how do we know if that is actually the agent.
- Deployment was started.
- Deployment fails upon next heartbeat as there is no 'agent_url'.

This patch places a conditional around the removal of the agent_url
value at the end of cleaning which allows nodes to transition as
through fast track as desired.

Change-Id: I2b5130a0845b327c2244d2d30a19842c46e1eed3
Story: 2007080
Task: 37991

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: I1acccd7222c8b824d37fe4c753b4f31e8caa5294

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: I1f7337188c99433e8c8560dc174824f5016d93cb

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I74b8afecb6a1a70ed6e06966794dc3a1694a4f37
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Use Placement 1.35 (root_required)

Placement microversion 1.35 gives us the root_required queryparam to GET
/allocation_candidates, allowing us to filter out candidates where the
*root* provider has/lacks certain traits, independent of traits
specified in any of the individual request groups.

Use it.

And add affordance for specifying such traits to the RequestSpec.

Which allows us to fix up the couple of request filters that were
hacking traits into the RequestSpec.flavor.

Change-Id: I44f02044ce178e84c23d178e5a23a3aa1208e502

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: If15c710457611cfeebb5c2ec9f352425c72d6015

commit_message:
Pass "store_id" to backend when transfer volume to image

Glance supports multiple stores now. In order to use this feature, on
patch #661676, it added parameter "store_id" when call function
"image_transfer.upload_image". We need to parse this parameter and pass
it to "image_service.update" function.

Closes-Bug: #1857094

Change-Id: I03747f54545ae3f91bf10de76d07de6828a419d6

Setting haproxy in front of memcache gives more reliable failover and

Change-Id: Iea4fb513fe8a46fe7d9c04ce90d0fbf0d156cc4f
'}, {'created': '2019-12-26 13:23:40.000000000', 'message': 'Document access memcached via haproxy

commit_message:
Document access memcached via haproxy

Failure of single memcached instance now causes some delays in API
responses even with usage of oslo_cache.memcache_pool
Setting haproxy in front of memcache gives more reliable failover and
minimize delays in case of memcached failure.

Change-Id: Iea4fb513fe8a46fe7d9c04ce90d0fbf0d156cc4f

commit_message:
Drop requirements for unsupported python versions

We stopped testing against py2 with commit df2a396, so remove
unsupported python versions from the requirements files.

Change-Id: I2aca65d734d7b6089f0e3ad7836f509f4b968098

commit_message:
Replace all-plugin to all in tempest plugin usage docs

According to tox.ini all-plugin command is seems to be deprecated.
The new tox job name is added to the documentation.

Change-Id: I6a9a9644399e54156085b8c1b4161e2cd77381bb

commit_message:
Remove duplicated ACL files

We have a couple of duplicate ACL files, remove them and use acl-config
to simplify the setup.

fdupes gerrit/acl found these:

gerrit/acls/zuul/zuul-sphinx.config

commit_message:
Assign Ansible Runner rc and status in the correct order.

rc is returend first and then status.
https://ansible-runner.readthedocs.io/en/latest/python_interface.html#the-runner-object

Change-Id: Ifae61f7528faae80b2dd873ca5f488b8fda2230b
Closes-Bug: #1859182
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Clean up roles data adjustment

1. The python_bin var is unused, so it should be removed.
2. Tasks should be seperated by a newline in order to easily see
   that they are seperate tasks.
3. The return code of 2 was in the wrong place. It should have been
   where the data was changed, as per the changed_when condition.
4. With the return code adjusted, the final task's condition also
   needed adjusting to match.

Related-Bug: #1856865
Change-Id: I916c3ed394f54561fff2a106288a667c0b877360

[{'created': '2020-01-10 09:50:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix copy from ready directory

This fixes failures produced when project name
doesn't starts with 'openstack/'

This is intended to unblock the use of tripleo-ci
that is now failing with projects that are not
hosted under the 'openstack/' prefix (like for
example x/tobiko).

Example of failure:

commit_message:
Fix package building for project names not starting with 'openstack/'

This fixes failures produced when project name
doesn't starts with 'openstack/'.

It disables verification for undefined variables resolving
bug when PS1 is not defined.

It prints out STDERR for debugging purpouse when package name
is not found to allow investigating on name mapping problems.

It cleanup shell code to make it easier to maintain.

Closes-Bug: #1859167
Closes-Bug: #1858890
Co-Authored-By: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5c1b0f8135b19029874428f18d52c97013e91cc0

commit_message:
Horizon logouts when keypair created over quota

Nova returns status 403 with error message when keypair quota exceeded.
Horizon interprets any 403 as unauthorized access and immediately
logouts user. Proposed patch prevents logout

Closes-bug: #1793488
Closes-bug: #1709765
Change-Id: If07cd3a0d214578a4c4151d0bd2980e2e23f05c7

(11 comments)

TLS job errors during deploy when registering keystone service and endpoints:

Could not find versioned identity endpoints when attempting to authenticate. Please check that your auth_url is correct. SSL exception connecting to https://169.254.169.10:35357: HTTPSConnectionPool(host=\\'169.254.169.10\\', port=35357): Max retries exceeded with url: / (Caused by SSLError(SSLError(\"bad handshake: Error([(\\'SSL routines\\', \\'tls_process_server_certificate\\', \\'certificate verify failed\\')],)\",),))\\n'"
}

This does not cause the task to fail though, and it fails later on in a weird way. My guess is that the kolla_keystone_service module (in kolla, docker/kolla_toolbox/kolla_keystone_service.py) is not handling the error properly. Also it's clearly not picking up the verify_certs module argument (which I think gets translated to 'verify' by the 'openstack_full_argument_spec' function).

One thing that jumps out is that it calls module.exit_json(failed=True) rather than just module.fail_json().

mnasiadka has a patch to switch away from this custom module to the upstream os_keystone_service and os_keystone_endpoint modules, but it is still at a proof of concept phase: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673949. I suppose it's a question of whether to put time into the current approach or a (potential) new one.

https://object-storage-ca-ymq-1.vexxhost.net/v1/86bbbcfa8ad043109d2d7af530225c72/logs_17/664517/8/check/kolla-ansible-ubuntu-source-scenario-tls/5df5da0/primary/logs/ansible/deploy'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-30 13:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-09-07 00:00:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I have investigated fixing this in the current shade / python-keystoneclient direction. From ansible.log, the initial issue is kolla_keystone_service.py : 62

        for _service in cloud.keystone_client.services.list():

The stack for this:

   for _service in cloud.keystone_client.services.list():
  File "/opt/ansible/lib/python2.7/site-packages/shade/_legacy_clients.py", line 95, in keystone_client
    self._identity_client
  File "/opt/ansible/lib/python2.7/site-packages/shade/openstackcloud.py", line 620, in _identity_client
    'identity', min_version=2, max_version='3.latest')
  File "/opt/ansible/lib/python2.7/site-packages/shade/openstackcloud.py", line 510, in _get_versioned_client
    if adapter.get_endpoint():
    
  Note no args passed to get_endpoint(). We would need to propagate the verify_cert param, I believe changing it to 'verify = False', as args. Then we are in keystoneauth library to the end of stack.
    
  File "/opt/ansible/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keystoneauth1/adapter.py", line 282, in get_endpoint
    return self.session.get_endpoint(auth or self.auth, **kwargs)

  ...

Trying to fix this in shade does not look to be straightforward. Its breaking in initialization of an object:

shade/_legacy_clients.py
    def keystone_client(self):
        # Trigger discovery from ksa
        self._identity_client

I think focusing on updating to openstack sdk is the correct direction.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-09-12 18:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-09-12 21:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-13 09:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

 > Is there also a reason we define the job only for ubuntu?

Yeah I was thinking we'd need to revisit this in a future discussion. We might consider just enabling TLS in all jobs but this seems like a good start."}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-10-02 16:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 39.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-10-03 11:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-03 17:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39: Code-Review-1

we know it breaks etcd (for zun) and masakari, not sure about nfv (broken elsewhere currently) - weekend is here and I will see if I can debug etcd before Monday - if yes, we fix it in there; if not - we merge this as it is'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-06 09:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 42: Code-Review-1

I changed my mind about this, we should not encourage people to run insecure. We deploy the self-signed cert as CA already which makes it trusted (or should at least) - best follow this apporach.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-10-06 14:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 42:

(1 comment)

Can you elaborate on: "We deploy the self-signed cert as CA already which makes it trusted (or should at least)". The services require the "insecure" flag to be enabled to accept the self-signed cert - otherwise it is rejected with exception.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-10-07 03:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 42:

Ignore code comment in last statement.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-07 06:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> Can you elaborate on: "We deploy the self-signed cert as CA already
 > which makes it trusted (or should at least)". The services require
 > the "insecure" flag to be enabled to accept the self-signed cert -
 > otherwise it is rejected with exception.

Hi, I think we may be better setting it as trusted (CA) than just allowing insecure. Self-signed is rejected because no trust has been created for it. If we make sure it gets accepted despite insecure, then we are sure we are setting trusts correctly.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-07 06:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> If we make sure it gets accepted despite insecure,

Should read: If we make sure it gets accepted *without* insecure,'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-20 17:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-20 17:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43: Code-Review-1 -Review-Priority

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43:

I was under the impression we were ditching this in favor of: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/686024/'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2019-12-24 08:06:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 43: Code-Review-1

Use a self-signed SSL certification and insecure=False is meaning less. it is the same with no tls.

The right direct is: add the self-signed cert CA into the container's ca bundle."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-01-10 14:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No longer following this approach.'}]

commit_message:
Add support for self-signed SSL certificates and TLS CI scenario

This is needed to support deployments with certificates not signed by a
trusted CA.

To enable the use of self-signed certificates, set 'kolla_verify_tls'
to 'no'.

Also add a CI test with TLS enabled. We use the 'kolla-ansible
certificates' command to generate self-signed certificates.

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network
Change-Id: I51bcc81b2691a8f0736e46804e73b35f07f6e68b
Co-Authored-By: James Kirsch <generalfuzz@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[Stein-Only] Create a dedicated log file for healthchecks for collectd

This is the Stein equivalent of https://review.opendev.org/701187.

It creates a dedicated log file for the container healthchecks if we're
running with podman container engine, and activate sensu client.

It depends on a patch that actually add a new log identifier for the
container healthcheck systemd units.

Change-Id: I7143ba61f86263bba2fcd1013c74b075ac0d08b7
Closes-Bug: #1856575
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/701523

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-08 09:51:02.000000000', 'message': "Change the python interpreter discovery mode.

Current default mode for the python interpreter discover inansible 2.8 is
auto_legacy. This patch changes the mode to auto, the biggest difference
respecting auto_legacy is 'If no entry is found, or the listed Python is
not present on the target host, searches a list of common Python interpreter
paths and uses the first one found' [0].
Currently, it has been observed some issues with the
discovered_python_interpreter fact not getting updated on specific scenarios
(for example, when upgrading the node from RHEL7 to RHEL8). This change is
expected to improve this situation.

[0] - https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/interpreter_discovery.html#
Related-Bug: #1856313

commit_message:
Change the python interpreter discovery mode.

Current default mode for the python interpreter discover inansible 2.8 is
auto_legacy. This patch changes the mode to auto, the biggest difference
respecting auto_legacy is 'If no entry is found, or the listed Python is
not present on the target host, searches a list of common Python interpreter
paths and uses the first one found' [0].
Currently, it has been observed some issues with the
discovered_python_interpreter fact not getting updated on specific scenarios
(for example, when upgrading the node from RHEL7 to RHEL8). This change is
expected to improve this situation.

[0] - https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/reference_appendices/interpreter_discovery.html#
Related-Bug: #1856313
Change-Id: Iaef4839bb15ec398537b5c57a441c8e28a552bc0
(cherry picked from commit 6b4f47dd4245133294e459d9a7d0c38fc9af21a6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-13 12:14:52.000000000', 'message': 'Mount /boot from the host within the nova-compute container

libguestfs expects to find /boot/vmlinuz-* for the running version of
the kernel. This check is duplicated in nova-compute when libguestfs has
failed to launch, providing a useful bread crumb for operators [1].

Obviously when this is called from within the nova-compute container in
the context of a TripleO deployment this can easily fail after a minor
update that has pulled in a newer container containing a newer kernel.
This check could also fail in the opposite case if the host kernel is
updated past the version present in the container.

This change works around this by simply passing the hosts /boot/ through
to the nova-compute container ensure libguestfs is able to always find
the correct version of vmlinuz.

This should also allow us to eventually drop the kernel RPM from the
nova-compute container that has been a constant source of maintenance
overhead in terms of CVEs etc.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/aa096fd18352fb9da94069ec2cab478eed5c6cca/nova/virt/disk/vfs/guestfs.py#L75-L97

Change-Id: Iadef8f3300bb1b5b995052c1a35a1becbfd5730c
'}, {'created': '2019-12-13 16:14:12.000000000', 'message': 'Mount /boot from the host within the nova-compute container

libguestfs expects to find /boot/vmlinuz-* for the running version of
the kernel. This check is duplicated in nova-compute when libguestfs has
failed to launch, providing a useful bread crumb for operators [1].

Obviously when this is called from within the nova-compute container in
the context of a TripleO deployment this can easily fail after a minor
update that has pulled in a newer container containing a newer kernel.
This check could also fail in the opposite case if the host kernel is
updated past the version present in the container.

This change works around this by simply passing /boot as read-only
through to the nova-compute container ensure libguestfs is able to
always find the correct version of vmlinuz.

This should also allow us to eventually drop the kernel RPM from the
nova-compute container that has been a constant source of maintenance
overhead in terms of CVEs etc.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/aa096fd18352fb9da94069ec2cab478eed5c6cca/nova/virt/disk/vfs/guestfs.py#L75-L97

Change-Id: Iadef8f3300bb1b5b995052c1a35a1becbfd5730c
'}]
commit_message:
Mount /boot from the host within the nova-compute container

libguestfs expects to find /boot/vmlinuz-* for the running version of
the kernel. This check is duplicated in nova-compute when libguestfs has
failed to launch, providing a useful bread crumb for operators [1].

Obviously when this is called from within the nova-compute container in
the context of a TripleO deployment this can easily fail after a minor
update that has pulled in a newer container containing a newer kernel.
This check could also fail in the opposite case if the host kernel is
updated past the version present in the container.

This change works around this by simply passing /boot as read-only
through to the nova-compute container ensure libguestfs is able to
always find the correct version of vmlinuz.

This should also allow us to eventually drop the kernel RPM from the
nova-compute container that has been a constant source of maintenance
overhead in terms of CVEs etc.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/aa096fd18352fb9da94069ec2cab478eed5c6cca/nova/virt/disk/vfs/guestfs.py#L75-L97

Change-Id: Iadef8f3300bb1b5b995052c1a35a1becbfd5730c

commit_message:
Build packages using DLRN in reverse order

When the build-test-packages role calculates the packages to build
from the change list, it follows a parent-first order. That means
that if patch A Depends-On patch B, we build first A, then B.

That's an issue when we need to respect the order because a successful
build of A requires the package containing B, so let's reverse
artg_change_list when doing the builds.

Change-Id: I16945e8ec3c37ea912f9d932c6f13b1ef19f6b8a

commit_message:
Make check_approval not require openstack_governance

Since the job will have to run on the Zuul executor, it needs to
only rely on stdlib, yaml and requests (which are already installed
on the executor).

Change-Id: Id4e5a88d352e95402d0899deceade6fed8146619

[{'created': '2020-01-04 23:21:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix iteration over a remote_ip_prefixes field

The remote_ip_prefixes filed of a KuryrNetPolicy has the
format: {'remote_ip_prefixes': {'pod_ip': 'np-namespace'}}.
Right now, we're iterating over each remote_ip_prefixes
dicts and retrieving its keys and values without fetching the
dict items causing a ValueError. This commit fixes the
issue by iterating over the dict items.

Closes-bug: 1858301

Change-Id: Ic40878a830bcc32da06c0ab2763f593595e81bf2

commit_message:
Fix iteration over remote_ip_prefixes field

The remote_ip_prefixes filed of a KuryrNetPolicy has the
format: {'remote_ip_prefixes': {'pod_ip': 'np-namespace'}}.
Right now, we're iterating over each remote_ip_prefixes
dicts and retrieving its keys and values without fetching the
dict items causing a ValueError. This commit fixes the
issue by iterating over the dict items.

Closes-bug: 1858301

Change-Id: Ic40878a830bcc32da06c0ab2763f593595e81bf2

commit_message:
Improve ChefSpec test speed by enabling caching

This updates all references of let(:chef_run) to cached(:chef_run) to
speed up tests. By doing this, we have to create a new cached(:chef_run)
block whenever we need to adjust node attributes for testing.

Speed was improved from 14 minutes 3 seconds to 3 minutes 41.8 seconds

Change-Id: I1233e25e69b956936fc19f5c57cedc529afbb730

commit_message:
Improve ChefSpec test speed by enabling caching

This updates all references of let(:chef_run) to cached(:chef_run) to
speed up tests. By doing this, we have to create a new cached(:chef_run)
block whenever we need to adjust node attributes for testing.

- Remove unused default recipe ChefSpec
- Formatting cleanup

Speed was improved from 3 minutes 9.1 seconds to 38.21 seconds

Change-Id: I470991c600bca0ad2b6a389923a2fe8c954b7008

commit_message:
Improve ChefSpec test speed by enabling caching

This updates all references of let(:chef_run) to cached(:chef_run) to
speed up tests. By doing this, we have to create a new cached(:chef_run)
block whenever we need to adjust node attributes for testing.

Additional fixes:
- Pull in openstack-network::ml2_core_plugin in server spec so that we get the
  default attributes set
- Remove unused shared_examples

Speed was improved from 4 minutes 18.7 seconds to 1 minute 2.73 seconds

Change-Id: Ib10a6828e6886a57527a5e5a506cc57364ec0c2a

Thanks, Sean.  We dropped the py2 testing and gates with change I376bd708ecc864f29c35b7225f875bb20a98cd3c.  This change will make there be some missing requirements if someone tries to install under py2.7.  I wonder whether we should include the change to add "python-requires = >=3.6" to setup.cfg as part of this patch, or do you want to do it as a followup?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-01-08 22:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Thanks, Sean.  We dropped the py2 testing and gates with change
 > I376bd708ecc864f29c35b7225f875bb20a98cd3c.  This change will make
 > there be some missing requirements if someone tries to install
 > under py2.7.  I wonder whether we should include the change to add
 > "python-requires = >=3.6" to setup.cfg as part of this patch, or do
 > you want to do it as a followup?

I don't believe we are setting that in setup.cfg anywhere else in openstack, but it wouldn't hurt. If you'd like to have that, I can update this patch and add it here.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-01-09 13:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Sean: I think we ("we" being openstack) should add it because the first py3-only release of openstack isn't going to support py3.5 (which is still supported upstream, although it's now in "security fixes only" mode), so I think it would prevent some confusion.  But let's think about it and do it (if at all) in a follow-up.'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2020-01-10 13:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

to get them back readable via a browser.

messages:

Very good! I like it. Is this something you created or has it been adapted from some other project?'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2020-01-10 09:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2020-01-10 09:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Well, it is based on my previous Java experience, to be honest (although I realize it might not be a popular thing to say within this community). During Mistral development I was collecting these practices and finally decided to write a document. Of course, for Python it's different, I tried to adapt them keeping Python's nature in mind. And this document is not full yet, I just think that it's already big enough for one patch. I'll be adding more things step by step when moving forward.

One good source of info that has also inspired me is the book called "Implementation Patterns" written by Kent Beck. It describes similar things, for Java.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2020-01-10 13:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2020-01-10 13:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> Well, it is based on my previous Java experience, to be honest
 > (although I realize it might not be a popular thing to say within
 > this community). During Mistral development I was collecting these
 > practices and finally decided to write a document. Of course, for
 > Python it's different, I tried to adapt them keeping Python's
 > nature in mind. And this document is not full yet, I just think
 > that it's already big enough for one patch. I'll be adding more
 > things step by step when moving forward.
 > 
 > One good source of info that has also inspired me is the book
 > called "Implementation Patterns" written by Kent Beck. It describes
 > similar things, for Java.

THUMBS UP.'}]

commit_message:
Streamline README for policy overrides

The appendix in the deploy-guide has recently been
refreshed. This is the eight of the nine charms that
support overrides to receive a streamlining in order
to cut down on duplication.

Some driveby formatting improvements.

Added a Bugs section.

Change-Id: Icd0f616a878a8d71ec3b853b9f0b8092439e6fa7

[{'created': '2020-01-08 19:37:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix permission error if Barbican is enabled for Swift

The config files need to be relabled too avoid permission errors, otherwise
the Barbican key ID is not set and Swift fails to start.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix permission error if Barbican is enabled for Swift

The config files need to be relabled too avoid permission errors, otherwise
the Barbican key ID is not set and Swift fails to start.

Closes-Bug: 1858845
Change-Id: Idb94fee8aee1de3b1c7338108ccd8b45b6f169bf

commit_message:
Active wait to retrieve the Agent stats

In functional test
"test_updating_metadata_doesnt_update_controller_stats", do an active
wait to retrieve the Agent stats until "ChassisMetadataAgentEvent" is
generated and a new stat is added to the global instance "AgentStats".

Change-Id: I6ed2573b71dc91a60d860537512bfcef7a212e17
Closes-Bug: #1841913

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-18 20:13:42.000000000', 'message': 'Switch some sphinx extension logging to debug level

Our docs job has a lot of output that is not generally very useful.
Rather than bloating our log files, this switches some log calls over to
debug level so they are only emitted if needed.

Change-Id: Id0440ef506d0bc896d6dd4ba30473f430a6606dd
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Switch some sphinx extension logging to debug level

Our docs job has a lot of output that is not generally very useful.
Rather than bloating our log files, this switches some log calls over to
debug level so they are only emitted if needed.

Change-Id: Id0440ef506d0bc896d6dd4ba30473f430a6606dd
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
